WorkItem.ClosedComment: Duplicate to a related Worgen issue, already fixed
WorkItem.Description:
When I loaded my character (goblin mage) from battle.net, the race defaulted to Worgen. When I changed it and tried to save, I received the following error. This seems to happen regardless of class (I tried with a goblin priest as well). Also, the goblin haste racial does not seem to be included in the stats:
 
There was an error generating the XML document.
 
Instance validation error: '14' is not a valid value for Rawr.CharacterRace.
 
   at System.Xml.Serialization.XmlSerializer.Serialize(XmlWriter xmlWriter, Object o, XmlSerializerNamespaces namespaces, String encodingStyle, String id)
   at System.Xml.Serialization.XmlSerializer.Serialize(Stream stream, Object o, XmlSerializerNamespaces namespaces)
   at Rawr.Character.Save(Stream stream, Boolean closeStream)
   at Rawr.UI.MainPage.SaveCharacter(Object sender, RoutedEventArgs args)
   at System.Windows.Controls.MenuItem.OnClick()
   at System.Windows.Controls.MenuItem.OnMouseLeftButtonDown(MouseButtonEventArgs e)
   at System.Windows.Controls.Control.OnMouseLeftButtonDown(Control ctrl, EventArgs e)
   at MS.Internal.JoltHelper.FireEvent(IntPtr unmanagedObj, IntPtr unmanagedObjArgs, Int32 argsTypeIndex, Int32 actualArgsTypeIndex, String eventName)Instance validation error: '14' is not a valid value for Rawr.CharacterRace.
 
   at Microsoft.Xml.Serialization.GeneratedAssembly.XmlSerializationWriterCharacter.Write2_CharacterRace(CharacterRace v)
   at Microsoft.Xml.Serialization.GeneratedAssembly.XmlSerializationWriterCharacter.Write21_Character(String n, String ns, Character o, Boolean isNullable, Boolean needType)
   at Microsoft.Xml.Serialization.GeneratedAssembly.XmlSerializationWriterCharacter.Write22_Character(Object o)
WorkItem.Summary: [Base] Goblin is not a valid race Error
